data.title: Exception of type `System.Exception`: Tried logging to non-existant channel exception
data.body:
When starting the game: 
it crashes with:

```
openra
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1920x1080
Using resolution: 1376x640
Detected OpenGL version: 3.0
Using OpenAL sound engine
Using default device
Available mods:
    cnc: Tiberian Dawn (release-20140722)
    d2k: Dune 2000 (release-20140722)
    modchooser: Mod Chooser (release-20140722)
    ra: Red Alert (release-20140722)
Loading mod: ra
Exception of type `System.Exception`: Tried logging to non-existant channel exception
  at OpenRA.Log.Write (System.String channel, System.String format, System.Object[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.Session.Deserialize (System.String data) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager, OpenRA.World world, Int32 clientId, OpenRA.Order order) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync+<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[Boolean] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1 fn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged (OpenRA.World world, System.Action fn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.TickInner (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

This is on the latest release.

data.title: NRE in ShroudRenderer
data.body:
A NRE in ShroudRenderer can occur if the loaded map contains no shroud revealing actors. Might sound funny, though my map has no shroud at all and none of the actor definitions are based on existing OpenRA ones (which have a `RevealsShroud` trait for example).

The workaround at this point is to have at least one actor tagged with `RevealsShroud` in the map.

A map that reproduces this: c264c6ef

Callstack:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.ShroudRenderer.Update(Shroud shroud, CellRegion region)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.ShroudRenderer.RenderShroud(WorldRenderer wr, Shroud shroud)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw() in c:\Users\Curtis\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 133
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick() in c:\Users\Curtis\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 490
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in c:\Users\Curtis\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 606
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in c:\Users\Curtis\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 626
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in c:\Users\Curtis\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 116
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in c:\Users\Curtis\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 39

```

data.title: Explosion effects are always drawn at center of cell
data.body:
...instead of at exact impact position. Might be fine for some cases, but for most - especially inaccurate weapons - it looks rather weird.

Regression from #6030. Fix could be included in #5937.

data.title: WaterImpactSound broken
data.body:
Regression from #6030.

If this isn't considered urgent, I guess we can leave it until I get #5937 into shape.

data.title: Fixed ThrowsShrapnel not using lower case weapon names
data.body: When looking at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6162/files I realized this is missing just here adding weird inconsistency.

data.title: #5618. Diplomacy Stance checks on weapons and warheads.
data.body:
Adds Diplomacy keywords for ValidTarget checks.
Changes:

Allows diplomacy stance checks to be done on warheads and weapons, using keywords in ValidTargets and InvalidTargets.
Additional changes: Changed Weapon.Impact to use Target instead of WPos. Moved some common functionality to DamageWarhead from derived classes.

Closes #5618.

Note. This pull request does not include the updated map.yaml for the various maps, but the upgrade rules are included.

Will create a test branch tomorrow.

data.title: Qeueu multiple commands for helo/planes not working
data.body:
Queuing of multiple command using the Shift key is not working for planes and helo's. They immediately execute the order that should be queued. 

Infantry and land units work correctly. Using latest release, noticed in RA.

data.title: Remove TakeOff activity from ReturnToBase
data.body: Reverting a change made in #5470. Currently if you order the plane to land by mouse, it stays landed. Using `F` (`ReturnToBase`) also lands the plane, but after rearming it will `TakeOff` and circle around the rallypoint.

data.title: Fix crate actions assuming collector has Mobile.
data.body:
A crate fell on a structure I had just built (cell was OK before paradrop).
This fixes the NRE from lack of `Mobile` but may have unintended side effects.

\+ a bit of code cleanup.

data.title: Write trait requirements in documentation.
data.body: I've not done any generated HTML in the past so please point out any formatting issues.

data.title: Unit lost sound bug
data.body: Seen in TD, when a full transport is killed the Unit lost sound is much louder than when a single unit is killed. I'm assuming this happens because the sound is being played for every unit that was killed.

data.title: #6128. Minor fixes for IonCannonPower and Bridge.
data.body:
Minor fixes. IonCannonPower can now define how many ticks into animation the weapon impact happens (as opposed to at the end of the animation. Bridge can now define weapon used for demolition, default = "Demolish" as previous.

Closes #6128.

data.title: Sonic Tank offset
data.body: Fixes the offset for the SonicZap weapon for the Disruptor tank.

data.title: Global player experience
data.body:
In the Generals/BFME games, there was a global experience meter, used to buy special powers.

After an X amount of exprience (Called SkillPoints in Generals), players got awarded SciencePurchasePoints, with which Special Powers could be bought.

In order to facilitate such a system, there has to be a way to track global experience for a player, and add experience to a player, on the basis of the GivesBounty trait.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3462940-global-player-experience?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Make infantry switch back to waiting/idling right after attacking
data.body: Fixes 2) of #5884.

data.title: Added money crates to be spawned by destroyed supply trucks
data.body: Implements https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3768#issuecomment-23623322 and does some small cleanups in the surroundings. This also makes use of the wooden crate sprite that we already ship since last year.

data.title: Fixed idle overlays being displayed during actor transformations
data.body: as described in #6018. Tiberian Sun construction yard is the only test case at the moment.

data.title: Disabled music installation during matches
data.body: to avoid the game to restart as described in #6058.

data.title: AI repairs all it's buildings when deteriorated by not building upon concrete
data.body: This makes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5784 worse.

data.title: Cannot sell captured buildings anymore
data.body:
If you have extra buildings on the map which you can capture (powerplants, whatever), you cannot sell them anymore. Was possible in previous release.

Is this intentional?

data.title: Remove debug messages when using the actor selection hotkey
data.body:
Separated from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6129#issuecomment-50971014

> `W` still has debug `selected across map` and `selected across screen` messages depending on use

This is intentional for the moment, because there currently is no polished GUI alternative yet.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: LaserZap projectiles are visible under fog.
Sonar pulse can be used as an overpowered spyplane
data.body:
It can instantly reveal any location on the map once every 30 seconds.

This should be restricted to water only (or more specifically a list of terrain types specified in the power), and the shroud reveal should be removed.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3460120-sonar-pulse-can-be-used-as-an-overpowered-spyplane?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add Ctrl+right-click cancelling to the production panel.
data.body:
Feature: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6082
Regression tested - From what I can see no bugs or performance issues.

Order.cs : Line 241: 
- Function ClearProduction() inputs new order to the ProductionQueue

ProductionQueue.cs: Line 323: 
- Case statement "ClearProduction" counts number of items paused for item
- Deletes all paused items for that icon and returns appropriate fees if applicable

ProductionPaletteWidget.cs: HandleKeyPress(KeyInput e) && bool HandleEvent(ProductionIcon icon, bool isLeftClick)
- Former to remember Control is key up or down with bool (hold/release)
- Latter to call new production order "ClearProduction" for item LCtrl + Click on

data.title: Vote Kick Admin in Lobby
data.body: We've all been in with full lobbys with AFK admins. This would just make those times a bit smoother

data.title: Merge pull request #6082: Ctrl+Click Clear Queue on Paused Item
data.body:
Regression tested - From what I can see no bugs or performance issues.

Order.cs : Line 241: 
- Function ClearProduction() inputs new order to the ProductionQueue

ProductionQueue.cs: Line 323: 
- Case statement "ClearProduction" counts number of items paused for item
- Deletes all paused items for that icon and returns appropriate fees if applicable

ProductionPaletteWidget.cs: HandleKeyPress(KeyInput e) && bool HandleEvent(ProductionIcon icon, bool isLeftClick)
- Former to remember Control is key up or down with bool (hold/release)
- Latter to call new production order "ClearProduction" for item LCtrl + Click on

data.title: Build Everything cheat does not work properly in TD
data.body: Only lets me build everything for the faction I'm playing as. Testing on bleed - seems to still work correctly in RA and D2K, but not TD
